title: Air Canada enRoute Magazine
content:
Looking to identify the sans serif used in enRoute magazine. I posted image samples.

Hope someones big brain can help me.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120154456im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/diningguide_3885.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120154456im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/header_6468.gif)

 [‹ custom type "kontakt" by dstype / similar font needed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120154456/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40667 "Go to previous forum topic") [Young & Rubicam logo font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120154456/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40710 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chrisshaddock

comments.content: Opening the pdf file [http://www.enroutemag.com/download/diningguide.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120154456/http:/www.enroutemag.com/download/diningguide.pdf "http://www.enroutemag.com/download/diningguide.pdf") with Acrobat you read “Whitney-Medium” for “Canada” and “Whitney-Book” for “Les Meilleurs....”

HA, silly me. I can’t believe that brain fart.

Thanks
